title: Treason&rsquo;s Tide - Robert Wilton
description:
An intense, imaginative and darkly atmospheric historical spy thriller - Patrick O'Brian meets John le CarrÃƒÂ©. (Previously published as The Emperor's Gold) July 1805: Napoleon's army masses across the Channel - Britain is within hours of invasion and defeat. Only one thing stands in the way - an obscure government bureau of murky origins and shadowy purpose: The Comptrollerate General for Scrutiny and Survey. And, rescued from a shipwreck, his past erased, Tom Roscarrock is their newest agent. In England, the man who recruited Roscarrock has disappeared, his agents are turning up dead, and reports of a secret French fleet are panicking the authorities. In France, a plan is underway to shatter the last of England's stability. Behind the clash of fleets and armies, there lies a secret world of intrigue, deception, treachery and violence - and Roscarrock is about to be thrown into it headfirst.
Unabridged.
Read by Cameron Stewart.
